document_title: Vaginal (private area) dryness: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Vaginal dryness occurs at all ages, most commonly in postpartum women – AFAB (Assigned Female At Birth – a term for a person of any age or gender who is considered a girl after birth) or during menopause when estrogen levels decrease. (first)
Doctor Nguyen Thi Quy Khoa said that the hormone Estrogen helps glandular cells develop, thickening the vaginal mucosa and secreting fluid to moisten the vagina. When Estrogen production is reduced, the vulvar vaginal mucosa becomes thinner and drier, less elastic and more vulnerable. This condition is quite common when women enter menopause, called vaginal atrophy.
Statistics show that about 17% of women in the AFAB group aged 18-50 years old said they experienced vaginal dryness during sex, even before menopause. More than half of cases have vaginal dryness after menopause.
